# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
using Threads

function pig_latinify(word::AbstractString)::AbstractString
    vowels = Set(['a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u','A', 'E', 'I', 'O', 'U'])
    
    if word[1] in vowels
        return word * "ay"
    else
        i = findfirst(isequal('a'), lowercase(word), 1, lastindex(word))
        if i == nothing
            i = findfirst(isequal('e'), lowercase(word), 1, lastindex(word))
        end
        if i == nothing
            i = findfirst(isequal('i'), lowercase(word), 1, lastindex(word))
        end
        if i == nothing
            i = findfirst(isequal('o'), lowercase(word), 1, lastindex(word))
        end
        if i == nothing
            i = findfirst(isequal('u'), lowercase(word), 1, lastindex(word))
        end
        
        if i == nothing  # if no vowel found, treat the whole word as a single consonant
            return word * "ay"
        else
            return word[i:end] * word[1:i-1] * "ay"
        end
    end
end

function pig_latin_transformer(words::Vector{<:AbstractString})::Vector{AbstractString}
    pig_latin_words = Vector{AbstractString}(undef, length(words))
    
    Threads.@threads for i in 1:length(words)
        pig_latin_words[i] = pig_latinify(words[i])
    end
    
    return pig_latin_words
end
```
